title: Meta will allow job candidates to use AI during coding tests
description: Meta is going to let job candidates to use artificial intelligence tools during coding tests.
content:
Meta will begin allowing candidates to use artificial intelligence during coding tests. The company has also asked existing employees to volunteer for a “mock AI-enabled interview,” as first reported by 404 Media and later confirmed by Meta.

description: Analyst Tyler Radke upgraded the artificial intelligence cloud computing stock.
content: Investors should buy the recent dip in CoreWeave as strong AI demand will power shares higher, according to Citi. Analyst Tyler Radke upgraded the artificial intelligence cloud computing stock to buy from neutral. His price target of $160 implies ups... [1168 chars]

title: AI infrastructure company fal raises $125 million, valuing company at $1.5 billion
description: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Artificial intelligence infrastructure company fal raised a $125 million Series C round valuing the company at $1.5 billion, the company said Thursday. Venture capital fund Meritech led the round with participation from Salesforce Ventures, Shopify Ventures and Google AI Futures fund. Existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners, Kindred Ventures, Andreessen Horowitz, Notable Capital, First Round Capital, Unusual Ventures and Village Global also participated in the round.
content:
An AI (Artificial Intelligence) sign is seen at the World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC) in Shanghai
By Anna Tong

title: AI Boom Boosts Big Tech's Market Value Amid Economic Uncertainty
description: Big Tech's massive investments in artificial intelligence are paying off, with companies like Microsoft, Meta, and Alphabet experiencing substantial revenue growth. As AI becomes a primary growth engine, these firms continue to increase their capital expenditures, despite economic uncertainties affecting other sectors, showcasing strong investor support.
content: Big Tech is dramatically increasing its investments in artificial intelligence, with substantial returns drawing in investors. In the April-June quarter, AI significantly boosted demand across internet search, digital advertising, and cloud computing... [714 chars]

title: Big Tech's AI Revolution: Skyrocketing Investments and Unprecedented Returns
description: Big Tech companies like Microsoft, Meta, and Alphabet are significantly increasing their spending on artificial intelligence, resulting in rising revenues. This shift highlights AI's role as a major growth driver, with analysts optimistic despite high capital expenditures. Microsoft's recent financial disclosures indicate substantial returns on AI investments.
content: In a bold move, Big Tech giants Microsoft, Meta, and Alphabet are dramatically increasing their investments in artificial intelligence, as they witness soaring returns on these ventures. The companies have recognized AI as a primary growth driver, in... [792 chars]

title: China summons chip giant Nvidia over alleged security risks
description: Chinese internet authorities summoned Nvidia on Thursday to discuss "serious security issues" over some of its artificial intelligence (AI) chips, as the US technology giant finds itself entangled in trade tensions between Beijing and Washington.And on Thursday, Beijing's top internet regulator said it had summoned Nvidia representatives to discuss recently discovered "serious security issues" involving the H20.
content:
Nvidia is a world-leading producer of AI semiconductors, but the United States effectively restricts which chips it can export to China on national security grounds (I-HWA CHENG) (I-HWA CHENG/AFP/AFP)

title: Google to sign EU’s AI code of practice despite concerns
description: The European Union enacted the guardrails for the use of artificial intelligence in an attempt to set a potential global benchmark for a technology used in business and everyday life
content:
Google was concerned that the AI Act and code of practice risk slowing Europe's development and deployment of AI. (Image: Reuters)

content:

title: Meta stock surges after Q2 results blow past expectations despite heavy AI spending
description: In the midst of an artificial intelligence spending spree, Meta posted stronger-than-expected results for the second quarter, buoyed by growing ad revenue even as its expenses increased.
content:
Meta’s artificial intelligence spending spree appears to be paying off with investors, who sent the company’s stock soaring after hours on Wednesday following a blowout quarterly earnings report.
